intro: Cleistanthus penangensis, commonly known as the Penang cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests, where it thrives in humid and warm climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
